  • Classes in it.uniroma1.mdp.view.game used by it.uniroma1.mdp.controller
    Class
    Description
    CardButton
    Represents a card button in the game interface.
    DiscardPileButton
    Represents the discard pile button in the game interface.
    GameFrame
    Represents the main frame for the game, containing the human display panel and the game table panel.
    StockPileButton
    Represents the stock pile button in the game interface.
    TimerLabel
    Represents a JLabel for displaying the elapsed time during the game as a timer.
    TrashButton
    Represents a button used to trash a card in the game session.

    Class
    Description
    CardButton
    Represents a card button in the game interface.
    DecksPanel
    This class represents the panel containing the decks and the drawn card in the game interface.
    DiscardPileButton
    Represents the discard pile button in the game interface.
    DrawnCard
    Represents the card drawn from the deck in the game interface.
    ExitGameButton
    Represents an exit game button displayed in the game session.
    GameTablePanel
    Represents the main game table panel where players and decks are displayed during the game.
    HandPanel
    Abstract class representing a panel to display a player's hand of cards.
    HorizontalHandPanel
    Represents a horizontal hand panel in the game, extending the HandPanel class.
    HuDisplayPanel
    Represents the panel displaying human-related information during the game.
    HumanPanel
    Represents the panel for the Human player in the game.
    StockPileButton
    Represents the stock pile button in the game interface.
    TimerLabel
    Represents a JLabel for displaying the elapsed time during the game as a timer.
    TrashButton
    Represents a button used to trash a card in the game session.
    TurnLabel
    Represents a JLabel for displaying the current turn in the game.
    VCardButton
    Represents a vertical card button in the game interface.
    VerticalHandPanel
    Abstract class representing a vertical hand panel to display a player's hand of cards.
